subject: Re: [junit] Testing constructors?
msgSnippet: ... The standard answer for all these kinds of question is: if it might break, then test it. As for constructors in particular, how would you know the
messageBody:
Pico Geyer wrote:

> I was just wondering what was the common practice on testing
> constructors.
> Should they be tested. If not why not?

The standard answer for all these kinds of question is: if it might
break, then test it.

As for constructors in particular, how would you know the constructor
was broken? If you get any interesting answers, such as something that
isn't covered by another test you have written/intend to write, then
write that test.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
